alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 17 at 5:26PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Navajo. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 525 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Fivemile Wash, Leroux Wash, Washboard Wash, East Washboard Wash, Porter Tank Draw, Little Colorado River and McDonald Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Navajo County - This includes State Route 377 between mile markers 22 and 33. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
